controls.name: Account Management
requirements: Define and document account types allowed on the system
Establish conditions for group and role membership
Specify authorized users and access authorizations
Require approvals for account creation requests
Create, enable, modify, disable, and remove accounts in accordance with policy
Notify account managers when accounts are no longer required, users are terminated or transferred, or system usage changes
Authorize access based on valid access authorization, intended system usage, and organizational approval
Review accounts for compliance on a defined frequency
Establish and enforce process for changing shared or group account credentials when members leave the group
assessment_objectives: Account types are defined and documented
Account managers are designated
Group and role membership conditions are established
Authorized users and access authorizations are specified
Account creation requires documented approval
Accounts are managed per documented lifecycle procedures
Account usage is monitored for atypical use
Notification procedures exist for account changes
Access authorization validates intended usage
Account reviews occur at the defined frequency
Shared/group credential change process is enforced

controls.name: Automated System Account Management
requirements: Support management of system accounts using automated mechanisms
assessment_objectives: Automated mechanisms are employed to support account lifecycle management

controls.name: Automated Temporary and Emergency Account Management
requirements: Automatically remove or disable temporary and emergency accounts after a defined time period
assessment_objectives: Temporary accounts are automatically removed or disabled after the defined time period
Emergency accounts are automatically removed or disabled after the defined time period

controls.name: Disable Accounts
requirements: Disable accounts when the accounts have been inactive for a defined time period
assessment_objectives: Accounts are disabled after the organization-defined time period of inactivity

controls.name: Automated Audit Actions
requirements: Automatically audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal actions
assessment_objectives: Account creation actions are automatically audited
Account modification actions are automatically audited
Account disabling actions are automatically audited
Account removal actions are automatically audited

controls.name: Inactivity Logout
requirements: Require users to log out when the organization-defined time period of expected inactivity is exceeded
assessment_objectives: Users are required to log out after the defined inactivity period

fedramp_parameters.inactivity_logout_period: 15 minutes for FedRAMP Moderate, 10 minutes for FedRAMP High

controls.name: Incident Handling
requirements: Implement an incident handling capability that includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery
Coordinate incident handling activities with contingency planning activities
Incorporate lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities into incident response procedures, training, and testing
assessment_objectives: An incident handling capability is implemented consistent with the incident response plan
Incident handling activities are coordinated with contingency planning activities
Lessons learned are incorporated from ongoing incident handling
